title: Major League Cricket Relocates Headquarters to Texas
body:
Major League Cricket (MLC) has announced the relocation of its headquarters from San Francisco to Grand Prairie, Texas, marking a significant milestone in the development of cricket in the United States. This move is set to establish Grand Prairie as the central hub of cricket in the country and align with the sport’s growing profile as it prepares for its return to the Olympics in 2028.

The decision to shift bases to Grand Prairie has multiple strategic advantages for Major League Cricket. The city has been witnessing a growth in cricket popularity, especially after hosting four ICC Men’s T20 World Cup matches in 2024. One of these matches included the U.S. team’s exciting Super Over victory against Pakistan, celebrated widely by fans.

The Grand Prairie Stadium, a former minor league baseball field, has been transformed into a vibrant hub for cricket fans and a key attraction for advertisers and broadcasters. This facility has played a pivotal role in cementing the city’s reputation as the epicenter of U.S. cricket.

The announcement was made on a Thursday, as preparations are underway for Major League Cricket’s third season, scheduled to kick off on June 12 in Oakland and subsequently move to Grand Prairie. Johnny Grave, the Chief Executive of Major League Cricket, expressed his enthusiasm about the relocation, noting the potential for hosting another sold-out championship final in Texas.

Grand Prairie’s Mayor, Ron Jensen, originally a baseball enthusiast, has also embraced the cricketing culture. His new-found interest reflects the city’s evolving sports dynamics. Furthermore, last year’s Men’s T20 World Cup had a substantial economic impact on Texas, generating over $100 million and bringing in a significant number of first-time international visitors.

In conclusion, Major League Cricket’s move to Grand Prairie is expected to have far-reaching benefits for the sport in the U.S., supporting its growth and visibility in preparation for future international events, including the 2028 Olympics.
summary:
**Key Update:** Major League Cricket (MLC) has relocated its headquarters from San Francisco to Grand Prairie, Texas.

**Reasons for Relocation:**
- Grand Prairie has been growing in cricket popularity, hosting 4 ICC Men's T20 World Cup matches in 2024.
- The Grand Prairie Stadium has been transformed into a vibrant hub for cricket fans and a key attraction for advertisers and broadcasters.

**Upcoming Tournament:**
- The third season of MLC is scheduled to kick off on June 12 in Oakland and then move to Grand Prairie.
- The Chief Executive of MLC, Johnny Grave, expects another sold-out final in Texas.

**Impact of Relocation:**
- The relocation is expected to have far-reaching benefits for the sport in the US, supporting its growth and visibility in preparation for future international events, including the 2028 Olympics.
- The 2024 Men's T20 World Cup had a significant economic impact on Texas, generating over $100 million and bringing in a large number of first-time international visitors.

title: Major League Cricket Moves Headquarters to Texas
body:
Major League Cricket (MLC) is taking strategic measures to expand its influence in the United States by moving its headquarters to Grand Prairie, near Dallas, Texas. This relocation signifies MLC’s commitment to enhancing its presence and attracting more viewership across the U.S.

The Texas Super Kings, one of the franchises in Major League Cricket, has notable ownership comprising Chennai Super Kings Cricket, Ross Perot Jr., and Anurag Jain. Anurag Jain expressed optimism about cricket’s future in the U.S., reflecting a positive outlook towards the sport’s growth potential in America.

MLC CEO Johnny Grave voiced his confidence regarding cricket’s popularity in the American market. He emphasized that it is not a question of whether cricket will establish itself in the U.S., but rather “how long” it will take to achieve recognition and popularity.

To foster this growth, MLC aims to establish a dedicated time slot in the cricket calendar, ensuring that its season does not clash with other significant tournaments worldwide. The current MLC season is scheduled from June 12 to July 13, running for a concise period of one month. This scheduling is intended to facilitate maximum participation and viewership.

Additionally, recognizing the challenges posed by the intense summer heat in Texas, the league has equipped stadiums with lighting facilities to host night matches. This decision allows for a more comfortable experience for both players and fans, ensuring that the matches can proceed without disruption due to high temperatures.

Launched in 2023, MLC features six teams representing various U.S. states. The league is now entering its third season, with the aim of attracting marquee players to further elevate the competition’s profile and draw more spectators.

In a broader context, cricket is set to make a significant comeback by being included in the Los Angeles 2028 Olympics. This development is likely to contribute to increasing cricket’s popularity and acceptance in the United States.

Overall, MLC’s strategic moves, including the relocation of its headquarters and the introduction of night matches, are clear indicators of its ambition to strengthen cricket’s foothold in the U.S. sports landscape.
summary:
**Relocation and Expansion**: MLC is moving its headquarters to Grand Prairie, Texas, to increase its presence and attract more viewership in the US.

**Ownership and Optimism**: The Texas Super Kings, owned by Chennai Super Kings Cricket, Ross Perot Jr., and Anurag Jain, are optimistic about cricket's growth potential in the US.

**CEO's Confidence**: MLC CEO Johnny Grave is confident that cricket will establish itself in the US, and it's just a matter of time.

**Scheduling and Stadiums**: MLC will have a dedicated time slot in the cricket calendar to avoid clashes with other tournaments. The current season runs from June 12 to July 13. Stadiums are equipped with lighting facilities to host night matches, to combat the intense summer heat in Texas.

**Growth and Ambition**: MLC aims to attract marquee players to elevate the competition's profile and spectators. Cricket's inclusion in the 2028 Los Angeles Olympics will contribute to its popularity and acceptance in the US.

**League Details**: MLC features six teams, representing various US states, and is now entering its third season.

title: MLC 2025 Preview: Top Run-Scorers Who Set the Stage on Fire in Past Seasons
body:
As Major League Cricket enters its third season, anticipation is building not just for the expanding fan base but for cricket enthusiasts worldwide. With global stars lighting up stadiums in Texas and North Carolina, MLC has proven it can serve thrilling, world-class T20 action. As we look ahead to MLC 2025, it’s the batters who’ve stolen the spotlight over the last two years—setting benchmarks with consistency, aggression, and flair.

Must Read: How Many Teams and Matches Are There in Major League Cricket 2025?

Let’s take a deep dive into the most prolific run-scorers in the league so far—and what to expect from them this season.

1. Nicholas Pooran – 568 Runs in 15 Matches

The West Indian powerhouse has been a revelation in MLC. Representing MI New York, Nicholas Pooran’s 568 runs have come at a blistering pace and an impressive average of 47.33. His six-hitting ability, fearless approach, and clutch performances have made him the league’s ultimate entertainer. Heading into 2025, Pooran is expected to remain MI’s X-factor with the bat, capable of turning games single-handedly.

2. Devon Conway – 514 Runs in 15 Matches

Steady, stylish, and strategic—Devon Conway has brought the perfect mix of classical batting and modern T20 flair to MLC. Playing for Texas Super Kings, Conway has delivered under pressure, anchoring innings and providing stability at the top. His 2025 campaign will be crucial as Texas look to dominate with a balanced top order.

3. Faf du Plessis – 466 Runs in 15 Matches

The former South African captain has been one of the biggest names to throw weight behind MLC. With 466 runs to his name, du Plessis’s impact extends beyond the scoreboard. His leadership and power-hitting have inspired younger teammates and helped Texas Super Kings build a strong identity. Expect more vintage Faf innings in 2025, especially on true American surfaces.

4. Quinton de Kock – 434 Runs in 14 Matches

Now set to represent MI New York, Quinton de Kock has already established himself as a key figure in the MLC narrative. His effortless strokeplay and ability to switch gears mid-innings make him one of the league’s most dangerous batters. With 434 runs and a role as a senior pro, QdK will be vital in MI’s 2025 ambitions.

5. Finn Allen – 381 Runs in 14 Matches

New Zealand’s Finn Allen is all about fireworks. Known for explosive starts, he scored 381 runs for the San Francisco Unicorns, often taking the attack to bowlers right from the first over. While inconsistency has slightly held him back, Allen remains a fan favorite and a potential breakout star for the 2025 season.

6 & 7. Travis Head and Steve Smith – 336 Runs Each

Two Australian heavyweights, Travis Head and Steve Smith, may have identical numbers, but their styles couldn’t be more different. Head brings aggression and strike power, while Smith offers calmness and calculated accumulation. Both playing for Washington Freedom, their combination will be a strategic weapon in the 2025 edition.

What to Expect in MLC 2025?

The article discusses the upcoming 2025 season of Major League Cricket (MLC) and highlights the top run-scorers from the previous two seasons. The top six batters are:

1. Nicholas Pooran (568 runs, MI New York) - known for his aggressive style and ability to turn games around single-handedly.

2. Devon Conway (514 runs, Texas Super Kings) - a steady and stylish batsman who provides stability at the top of the order.

3. Faf du Plessis (466 runs, Texas Super Kings) - a powerful hitter and leader who has inspired his teammates and will be crucial for Texas in 2025.

4. Quinton de Kock (434 runs, MI New York) - a senior pro with effortless strokeplay and the ability to switch gears mid-innings.

5. Finn Allen (381 runs, San Francisco Unicorns) - known for explosive starts and a potential breakout star for the 2025 season.

The article expects these top batters to continue their form and play a crucial role in the 2025 MLC season.

Forest-conservation and annexation plans submitted to Frederick’s Planning Commission in late March reveal that the Washington Freedom Major League Cricket team is planning to build their first stadium in Frederick, Maryland. It would be located between I-70 and 144 at the site of the I-70 Golf Range.

The stadium is proposed to have a maximum capacity of 25,000 spectators, a possible hotel and retail expansion, and a river walk along the Monocacy River. The developer hopes to use the space for high school graduations and festivals outsides regular cricket season.

title: New Zealand set to beco...
body:
New Zealand Cricket will become the first full member of the ICC to launch a franchise in an overseas professional cricket league. NZC is set to team up with United States-based company True North Sports Ventures (TNS) to launch a new Major League Cricket franchise, set to debut in the 2027 season. NZC has become a foundation investor in TNS, with the possibility to make a more substantial equity investment before the end of 2025.

NZC will provide high-performance and management support, including coaching, management and support staff. MLC co-founders Sameer Mehta and Vijay Srinivasan are the majority owners of entities which hold exclusive rights to own and operate two MLC expansion franchises, the first of which will be launched by TNS in 2027. They are exploring key markets across North America, including Canada’s Toronto and US’s Atlanta to base the new franchise. Mehta and Srinivasan had co-founded Willow TV, North America’s premier cricket broadcaster, before they co-founded the MLC in 2023.
